reviewText:
Early Access Review

i love this game, bugs and all
worth the money for sure


the only bugs that can really be a bother
*on the video editing screen, about half the time slot tokens wont place and then they act dead so you cannot move them or use them anymore
*after a while the computer screen will go blank when your trying to exit from editing or shopping and the game needs restarting to fix it
*theres a 50/50 chance that when you exit a course mid way though and try to continue it, it wont continue and you have to repay for the course but the timer goes back to where you left it, im not sure if that is a known feature though

other then those minor problems this game is a diamond, i cannot stop playing it

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Youtubers Life: The somewhat accurate game simulator... for you!

See if you can survive being a youtuber filled with:
Angry mothers and studying everyday, only to get a B+...
Crappy friends who barge in your room to destroy your productivity...
Working outside non-stop until you can pay your rent, but you won't progress unless you move,
People complaining about editing when editing is actually on fleek,
Haters still hating when we stop collaborating just to pay our rent,
That unloyal friend who hates you and hopes you to fail if you move out without him instead of being a good friend and support you,
Friendships breaking like twigs when all you need is cash,
The somewhat annoying and weird voices for any communication.
A ding (yes, a ding like getting an achievement ding) sound when you lose friendship,
Hunger levels that can drop down to zero and not die,
and so much more!
With only $10.99 (I dunno the actual dollar price), you can receive:
The game!
...That's it. What do you expect?

Hurry up and buy now!
While stocks last. Limited edition. Youtubers edition.

What are you waiting for? Hurry up and join the bandwagon of hundreds of famous youtubers and other tens of thousands of players who play this game, or you will be the one that is left out!

GG 10/10.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I really like simulation games and had to get this as soon as I saw it. I may have played a bit too much in the 4 days that I've owned the game, but what can I say? This game is addicting! Long game short, you get to eat, sleep, work part time jobs for extra cash, play video games, edit them, post them, get feedback, improve editing skills, go online shopping, go to parties, go to movies, and talk to people. By the way, if you get this game, don't try flirting with other characters. It doesn't work. At least for me it doesn't... :(

Anyway, it's a great game, worth the price!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Edit: Because this is still in Early access I would try not to get mad this time. I would also want to say that the people who made this game are great. They always listen to their fans or at least actual Youtubers who are playing this game to fix the game and make it better.

Recommendations:
1. When we are in the store, could you please make the time stop? It gets really annoying when I go shopping to get new games (if there are any) or just get food/ new equipment only to realize I've been shopping for a lot of hours in-game time. A lot of wasted time there. I would also say you should also do this for editing then I realized that it is actually realistic to make time keep going when we edit because it really does take a long time to edit.

2. When playing games, the options where you get to choose action cards or whatever it's called is always high when we progress far into the game so we don't get to always finish the video. Even if I choose the lowest card everytime, even if it's not the right one, I never get to finish the video. Would you allow us to pick the cards we want to use every video? Or at least make it possible to actually give the video an ending.

3. Allow us to skip tutorials.

I would put new recommendations and mention glitches next time. These were the only things I could think of on the top of my head (I haven't played for 2 days because I've been busy).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is an interesting game, a tycoon game in which you create videos for a living, as a fellow YouTuber myself I would recommend this game for others.

EARLY ACCESS GAME REVIEW:

The game first starts with you creating your character and choosing what kind of videos you want to make. Then it starts you in your room, this is actually a good setting since most YouTubers start with living with their parents. Then you make the videos and start to get subscribers and views for your channel. Then the game will start to have you move up in housing, so that way you don't have to study in the other houses. As progressing you will make more money than ever before.

THINGS TO WORK ON:

Here is a few suggestions for the future to help improve in the future.
1. Instead of only having a Sound menu when going into the menu screen, add more menus to the menu.
2. I feel that you should keep videos up, so that they can still be viewed, rather than assume nobody wants to see them anymore.
3. Have a total at the end of the month, subtract the money from how long you stayed in a place from the total, and the amount for an intern.

CONCLUSION:

Overall, I feel that this game has alot of potential to it, but there is a few things that can be worked on in order to make this a great game. 8/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

IMPORTANT: This review is in the early access of this game.
I wanted to enjoy this game. I really did. It's like a mix of The Sims and Tube Tycoon. But after awhile, it just gets to the point where you're just doing the same thing over and over again. It's a fun game if you only want to play for a few hours, but getting to the point where you have the most subs on youtube will take too much of your time, and it's too repetitive. You make video after video, and if you're not at top health (slept already, ate food) then you won't be able to make a good video. There are some bugs, too. Sometimes your roommate comes in, says he will play on your computer, but you're making a video on it, so he leaves, but then he appeared in the chair as soon as the video uploaded. It's too buggy and there's not much to do in my opinion yet. Save your money. If you want a game like this that's worth your while, buy The Sims on a game keys site for cheaper.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The idea of this game is that your running your own youtube channel and have to bring your channel to the top by creating interesting content that your viewers will want to watch.

From what I can tell after playing several hours of this game that it is in a playable state (with some minor bugs). The only downside at this point in time is that you're stuck with being a gaming channel"  and the other options such as cooking or being lifestyle vlogger for example is not yet available.

So keep that in mind if you choose to purchase this game now
date:
your stuck with only one option of what kind of channel you can run.

Besides that the game is pretty fun if your into a casual management sim. I do think that the developers should consider maybe adding more types of youtube channel options down the road then the ones they will put in later. Maybe a skit-comedy channel as an option prehaps.

I will say out of the Early Access games I've played this one from the start feels almost complete and has a lot of potential.

Still go into this knowing that all the features are not there yet and you can only play as a gaming channel youtuber at the moment."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Youtuber's Life is a pretty darn fun game on my opinion. Although I don't think it's really worth 15$, I think it should be worth 10$. But the developer is the one to choose, so its not my choice. I got addicted 1 hour in and im still definitely playing it! The sims is like a sister to it, this game is just like it but it involves youtuber things. For an early access game its great! Here's somethings to look toward to in this game, and somethings that arent too good (pros and cons)

PROS:
-Great, silly graphics that go well with the game.
-Customization is great too, involving choosing your clothes, shoes, pants, Etc...
-This game kinda matches the title, Youtubers Life. You make videos, edit them, then see if its good or not to post it. People watch the videos and you can see the comments. It shows how much views you got, subscribers, and the amount of money. You move and have to pay bills and all that stuff. You make friends, go to partys, visit the movies, Etc... Theres more cool details, but this pro is long xD. (Also in the cons theres some NON-realistic things, but theres more realistic than non)
-You buy items like decoration, games, objects for your recording setup, and ofcourse etc...
-There is basic things like getting proper sleep and food so that makes it MORE REALISTIC!
(There is WAY more pros but they are DETAILS and ofcourse im not going to spoil everything =D)

CONS:
-Some things are NOT too realistic if the title is based on something irl (In real life = irl).
-Theres some glitches, I've only come across one but I bet there's some more.
-There's 1 typo that I've come across but ofcourse, I bet there's a little more.
-Like I said, I think the game should be 10$ instead of 15$, but that's not my choice.
-They exaggerate friend relationships.
-You get to much copywright things. In the game you have cards" That are actually your editing choice. Some
recommended: of the "cards" are copywright. they are better for a choice to use but you have to pay lots of money if you publish the video. Sometimes your bar is full of them and you have no choice of using one. Thats means it's definite to pay money.(I hope i explained it good
hoursPlayed:
but if you dont understand what im saying then you will when you buy the game xD)
- I think the total amount of gameplay is around 30 hours. Idk if thats a pro or con but most of the games I play are WAY more.

I hope you guys got an idea if you want to buy this game or not! This is an early access game but it is pretty good. If you want the full
voteText: or not having any cons
helpfulPercent: game then I'd suggest to buy it when not early access. But yeah I hope I gave you guys an idea and have a great day!!!"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you ever played Game Dev Tycoon (or the original Game Dev Story) you played this.

Visually, it feels like Game Dev with improved graphics, but gameplay and mechanics are not just similar, they are exactly the same. Both use the same basic formula to make their products (games/youtube videos), and the way you use that formula will tell if they'll be good or bad.

The main difference (well, the only difference, really) is that Youtubers Life throws some social elements from The Sims into the mix. So, while you need to make more and better videos to get more subscribers, money and fame, you also need to eat, sleep, study, socialize with people, go to parties and events, find other jobs while your videos are not making enough money and so on.

So, you have a game that is basically a mix between Game Dev and a simplified version of The Sims. Is it worth it?

First, remember this is EA, so expect bugs, framerate issues even with high end computers. The game is far from being optmized. If stuff like that bothers you, don't get anywhere near it for now.

That being said, as long as you understand what EA is, if you like Game Dev and The Sims, chances are you'll like this. If you never played those, you can give it a try, it's not like you'll waste a lot of money anyway. It feels repetitive after a while, the social elements are just that, elements, so don't expect too much veriety on that department. However, even when you realize you're doing the same stuff over and over again, the gameplay is interesting enough to keep you going to get more subscribers and all the fame and money that comes with that. The rewarding rags to riches" feeling you get in (good) tycoon games is there
date: although I have to say in it's current state is not very challenging once you start to figure out how it works
recommended: so keep that in mind.\n\nI'll try to keep this thing updated."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I love this game. I really do! But it is definetly not finished yet.
Pros-
Cute graphics
AI that won't make you want to kill your PC
Rip-offs over the phone
Somewhat realistic
Fun until you beat it
Cons-
First event stalls at 81% (They might've fixed that)
Video making process is annoying, especially when you get 3 copyrighted clips in a row
Bug where your HUD dissapears (This happens a lot)
Bug when where you accept something, the people deny their own request to you.

Overall, good game!
But wait until it is out of early access, or until most bugs are fixed.

-Sonic

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is so bad that even comparing the game to the likes of Sonic '06 is too much.

CONS--------

- The game is clearly trying to milk off of the success of famous Youtubers. I'm pretty sure the majority of people who like this game are children fantasizing to become the next Pewdiepie or AVGN. What next, are we going to get a DeviantArt simulator, so we can milk off of the success of Leonardo Da Vinci or Edgar Allen Poe? SO original!

- Bugs. Are. EVERYWHERE. Before I bought the game, I heard it crashed every time; when the game starts up, when you upload a video, when you save, when you LOAD. I've only played the game for what, 30 minutes?, and I've already experienced a plethera of graphical glitches, CTDs, etc.!

- Speaking of saving, they can't even get autosaves right. Every time you load an autosave, the game would either crash or mess up the save and receive undesirable results. Even Sonic '06 knew how to autosave, and if any game can't get that right, you know you ♥♥♥♥ed it up.

- Have I ever mentioned that this is literally a clone of My Sims? It's obvious!

- The saddest thing is, I can't even refund it; because I bought the game with two other games in one transaction, and I don't want to refund the other games that I haven't even installed yet!

PROS-----

- The fact that I got this game for a discount.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Has some rather typical issues with game-balance and a few bugs here and there (You can get 4 hours into a game and it just stops using the delivery system, effectively crippling the entire save).

That being said, the overall aesthetic and theme are surprisingly good. The game is totally worth trying, but perhaps later in the year when the devs have tended to more bugs and created a more stable game.

Performance is a concern right now but the devs seem active enough that I've convinced myself not to consider it a major negative *for now*. At the moment I've got a 980Ti that runs in the late 70s-celsius to keep this game at a stable 60FPS on 1440p. Happily delves into the early 80s and becomes rather loud at 4K. Basically this game currently consumes about the same horsepower as Witcher 3 with everything set to High.

If you enjoyed the atmosphere of The Sims Bustin' Out though, this is the game for you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Note: This game is in early access, my comments/concerns may be addressed later in the development.

What, oh what, can I say about YouTubers Life? It brings me back to my childhood, when I used to really enjoy playing tycoon games, even if I didn't really understand them. I see a lot of that in YouTubers Life, mixed with a dash of a casualized Sims game.

YouTubers Life is a game where you play as an up-and-coming YouTuber as you try to become the next PewDiePie. Right now, only gaming channels are playable in the game, with options for several later. You start off small, making pennies on every video you release, but you grow rather rapidly. Living in your mom's house, you get free meals, all you have to do is go to school and pass monthly tests. It seems rather too willing to let you learn the ropes here, however, because it threw me into the second location rather early on.

Part of the game features socialization with other YouTubers. You can chat with, befriend, or even date fictional YouTubers in order to grow your circle and possibly collab with them. I haven't explored this too far, but it seems a little...forced. It says at any time you can do the different events (i.e., a trip to the movies) but it doesn't tell you how.

The game seems to have a few localization issues. I believe the game was originally created in either Spanish or Portugese, and not all of the text has been converted over to English. Seeing as this is early access, and the fact that the few localization errors don't pose a big problem in gameplay (they just look out of place) it's something that I can live with.

Another problem is the crashes. It seems rather stable, but it can be prone to crashes, especially in the 'talent tree' where you spend talent points to upgrade your YouTuber. I hope they fix that soon.

All in all, YouTubers life has the potential to be something great. At the moment, its a game that I've lost a few hours in and will probably lose a few more. It seems to have roots in Game Dev Tycoon by Greenlight Games and, if so, it doesn't shame its inspirations.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Note: This game is in early access, my comments/concerns may be addressed later in the development.

What, oh what, can I say about YouTubers Life? It brings me back to my childhood, when I used to really enjoy playing tycoon games, even if I didn't really understand them. I see a lot of that in YouTubers Life, mixed with a dash of a casualized Sims game.

YouTubers Life is a game where you play as an up-and-coming YouTuber as you try to become the next PewDiePie. Right now, only gaming channels are playable in the game, with options for several later. You start off small, making pennies on every video you release, but you grow rather rapidly. Living in your mom's house, you get free meals, all you have to do is go to school and pass monthly tests. It seems rather too willing to let you learn the ropes here, however, because it threw me into the second location rather early on.

Part of the game features socialization with other YouTubers. You can chat with, befriend, or even date fictional YouTubers in order to grow your circle and possibly collab with them. I haven't explored this too far, but it seems a little...forced. It says at any time you can do the different events (i.e., a trip to the movies) but it doesn't tell you how.

The game seems to have a few localization issues. I believe the game was originally created in either Spanish or Portugese, and not all of the text has been converted over to English. Seeing as this is early access, and the fact that the few localization errors don't pose a big problem in gameplay (they just look out of place) it's something that I can live with.

Another problem is the crashes. It seems rather stable, but it can be prone to crashes, especially in the 'talent tree' where you spend talent points to upgrade your YouTuber. I hope they fix that soon.

All in all, YouTubers life has the potential to be something great. At the moment, its a game that I've lost a few hours in and will probably lose a few more. It seems to have roots in Game Dev Tycoon by Greenlight Games and, if so, it doesn't shame its inspirations.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

After playing it for 4 hours straight, I found that some things were just off and a bit too difficult.

1. Whenever I would hire a collaborator, their level would be almost instantly higher than mine.
2. Whenever I would make a video after I had a collaborator by myself, I would never have any sort of popularity regardless of the fact that I was the boss of the channel.
3. Sometimes, when making a collab video with your official collaborator, the game would stay at a state of recording, even though the video was finished.

I believe that this game has so much potential and can become something amazing if the developer were to just optimize and look into fixing the bugs. Other than those reasons, the game is enjoyable, and I could play it for hours more.

Edit (May 22, 2016 16:49 EST): I also found that I would HAVE to get the 3 person apartment in order to change networks, I believe that this is a bad idea, I think that the game should allow players to join a network as soon as they have the subs to do so.

Overall Recommended(It was literally just bordering on not recommended)

However slightly over priced at the moment in my opinion I would say WAIT!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

INTRODUCTION:

YouTubers Life is an interesting game, in the sense that I've always wanted this kind of game to exist, but I never knew how someone was going to make it. YouTubers Life is a mix of similar games such as The Sims and many Tycoon-style games. You're given a character creator, you make your YouTuber, and you're set out to complete various actions and goals to build your channel, network, friendships, and more, while also taking care of your YouTuber's basic necessities (hunger, sleep, etc.) While this game is a lot of fun, quite addicting, and has a lot of -promise-, this game isn't perfect. Early Access is a tag slapped onto the front page of this game, and that makes us wonder, will the developer(s) run with our money or follow through with their promises? We can only hope it's the latter.

PROS:
- Despite being Early Access, YouTubers Life has more content than the current price tag. ($1 = 1 Hour of Gameplay)
- Graphic style is silly, yet I believe that adds to the game's colorful personality.
- Character customization is fairly good for being Early Access, in physical appearance and clothing options.
- There are many things to collect in the game. House items, computer upgrades, personal clothing, and more.
- Always saving (however, this could be a -con- as well.)
- Tugs at your strings to think strategically, as producing and editing your video requires some patience and proper placement of cards, clips and effects for the best possible video.
- Provides a good sense of character development. You'll begin in your mother's house, eventually move out into an apartment with a friend, and more. You will always be upgrading something in this game, from your computer to your personal life.
- Good tutorial. If there's something new put into the game, you can guarantee the game is going to tell you all about it. You're often forced to go along with the tutorial as well. However, I found that I could get ahead of the tutorial sometimes and I'd get explanation about things I already knew.
- Ripping off company, video game, and brand names was quite funny to me. You could argue that this doesn't push creativity, but I think it adds to the game's personality.


CONS:
- Music is severely lacking. As far as I could tell, only one single song repeatedly loops while you're at home. You're given a single song based off of your area. There needs to be more variety.
- Sound effects could be improved on. The developer(s) have a good idea of what they're going for with voices, it's very -Sims- like, in the sense that there's a mix of words you can't understand while they speak. Voice actors and sounds could have a better overall quality.
- There are some translation errors that still exist in the game, as well as grammar mistakes that make certain dialogue weird to read. I believe the developer(s) should hire a translator ASAP, this task shouldn't be very hard.
- No option to speed up" the gameplay for specific things. Features such as your character studying to learn certain skills
date: this takes a long time and it's quite boring to watch them stare at a book for so long. When waiting on a video
recommended: you could sleep or do something else. With studying? That isn't an option.\n- RNG cards can be fairly annoying while producing a video. Sometimes you're forced to use copyrighted material in a video
hoursPlayed: or you don't get a matching card
voteText: which ruins the production and can stab you in the back. I enjoy that there's a struggle
helpfulPercent: but sometimes it's too harsh.\n- There should be several saves that you can make
votesHelpful: instead of being locked to a constant auto-saving feature. I've read that if you don't pay your rent
votesTotal: the game will end on you. I've never had this issue
votesFunny: but that just sounds terrible.\n- Receiving items you've purchased can be repetitive. Each individual item will appear in a box next to your door that you have to click on. Imagine waiting on each item if you buy many things at once. I'm not easily annoyed by this
commentsCount: but I can see how others would complain about it.\n- Repetition in dialogue
column16: video game covers
column18: everything. There needs to be a larger variety with everything to make the experience feel unique.\n- Channel subscribers
column19:
views and ratings seem a little unrealistic to me. I think that you should start off A LOT smaller after your first few videos. Success is not found that easily.

CONCLUSION:

The YouTubers Life developer(s) seem to have recognized the popularity that has been brought to their game
column20: and hopefully that is enough motivation for them to finish their game and listen to their community. In it's current state
column21: if you enjoy this genre of game
column22: I'd recommend buying it and supporting the developer(s) for creating what they have so far. I'd like to note that this game won't appeal to everyone
column23: so I'd recommend doing your research beforehand. Also
column24: the golden rule of $1 = 1 Hour of Entertainment looks like it'll be met
column25:
so I'm very happy about that.

RATING:

YouTubers Life receives a 9/10 for me
column26: and I can see this game being a 10/10 for if the developer(s) follow through with their promises
column28:
and add/fix the content that people are talking about.

NOTES:

- I've read about people crashing while playing this game
column29: but I haven't once ever experienced that before."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is as the title says. It's a game where you start as a succesful Youtuber, and explain how you got there. You start off as an aspiring youtuber, and slowly progress your way through levels, granting further ways to produce higher quality videos.

The idea of the game is interesting , and one you can easily spend time playing; however I felt after a couple of hours that the game play had become repetative and stale. I found myself repeating the same things every day: Sleep, eat and create a video. At the start of the game you do also have to juggle studying as well, though your mother never seems happy when you study.

The game does offer things to do outside of your room; however I found little use to these, other than meeting new people, and even that didn't seem to make much difference to my day to day life.

If you are a fan of other sims, where you slowly become a better gamer, games creator etc, then you will surely find this game fun. However I was personally hoping for a bit more.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Youtuber's Life Review: Early Access
For an Early access game it has content but the question is are they going to add more as I currently have 6hours 30mins into the game and about 5 hours of that was actual play, honestly the content is lacking and get's repetitive and doesn't seem like they can really add much to change that. In term of hours to money spent (I consider a game worth it when each hour = £1 spent) it should be much much cheaper. It is a GOOD game but honestly it is lacking in the actual video making mechanic, you can check my game time for Game Dev Tycoon and see how much play I got out of that.

Pros:
Enjoyable

Well made (Not many bugs, I only experienced 1 crash)

Nice graphic style

Cons:
Short game

Too expensive

Lacking gameplay features

Video Making (Main game element) is lacking and not explained to the fullest (However I can see with new youtuber content types this could be improved drastically

Overall Recommended(It was literally just bordering on not recommended)

However slightly over priced at the moment in my opinion I would say WAIT!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

INTRODUCTION:

YouTubers Life is an interesting game, in the sense that I've always wanted this kind of game to exist, but I never knew how someone was going to make it. YouTubers Life is a mix of similar games such as The Sims and many Tycoon-style games. You're given a character creator, you make your YouTuber, and you're set out to complete various actions and goals to build your channel, network, friendships, and more, while also taking care of your YouTuber's basic necessities (hunger, sleep, etc.) While this game is a lot of fun, quite addicting, and has a lot of -promise-, this game isn't perfect. Early Access is a tag slapped onto the front page of this game, and that makes us wonder, will the developer(s) run with our money or follow through with their promises? We can only hope it's the latter.

PROS:
- Despite being Early Access, YouTubers Life has more content than the current price tag. ($1 = 1 Hour of Gameplay)
- Graphic style is silly, yet I believe that adds to the game's colorful personality.
- Character customization is fairly good for being Early Access, in physical appearance and clothing options.
- There are many things to collect in the game. House items, computer upgrades, personal clothing, and more.
- Always saving (however, this could be a -con- as well.)
- Tugs at your strings to think strategically, as producing and editing your video requires some patience and proper placement of cards, clips and effects for the best possible video.
- Provides a good sense of character development. You'll begin in your mother's house, eventually move out into an apartment with a friend, and more. You will always be upgrading something in this game, from your computer to your personal life.
- Good tutorial. If there's something new put into the game, you can guarantee the game is going to tell you all about it. You're often forced to go along with the tutorial as well. However, I found that I could get ahead of the tutorial sometimes and I'd get explanation about things I already knew.
- Ripping off company, video game, and brand names was quite funny to me. You could argue that this doesn't push creativity, but I think it adds to the game's personality.


CONS:
- Music is severely lacking. As far as I could tell, only one single song repeatedly loops while you're at home. You're given a single song based off of your area. There needs to be more variety.
- Sound effects could be improved on. The developer(s) have a good idea of what they're going for with voices, it's very -Sims- like, in the sense that there's a mix of words you can't understand while they speak. Voice actors and sounds could have a better overall quality.
- There are some translation errors that still exist in the game, as well as grammar mistakes that make certain dialogue weird to read. I believe the developer(s) should hire a translator ASAP, this task shouldn't be very hard.
- No option to speed up" the gameplay for specific things. Features such as your character studying to learn certain skills
date: this takes a long time and it's quite boring to watch them stare at a book for so long. When waiting on a video
recommended: you could sleep or do something else. With studying? That isn't an option.\n- RNG cards can be fairly annoying while producing a video. Sometimes you're forced to use copyrighted material in a video
hoursPlayed: or you don't get a matching card
voteText: which ruins the production and can stab you in the back. I enjoy that there's a struggle
helpfulPercent: but sometimes it's too harsh.\n- There should be several saves that you can make
votesHelpful: instead of being locked to a constant auto-saving feature. I've read that if you don't pay your rent
votesTotal: the game will end on you. I've never had this issue
votesFunny: but that just sounds terrible.\n- Receiving items you've purchased can be repetitive. Each individual item will appear in a box next to your door that you have to click on. Imagine waiting on each item if you buy many things at once. I'm not easily annoyed by this
commentsCount: but I can see how others would complain about it.\n- Repetition in dialogue
column16: video game covers
column18: everything. There needs to be a larger variety with everything to make the experience feel unique.\n- Channel subscribers
column19:
views and ratings seem a little unrealistic to me. I think that you should start off A LOT smaller after your first few videos. Success is not found that easily.

CONCLUSION:

The YouTubers Life developer(s) seem to have recognized the popularity that has been brought to their game
column20: and hopefully that is enough motivation for them to finish their game and listen to their community. In it's current state
column21: if you enjoy this genre of game
column22: I'd recommend buying it and supporting the developer(s) for creating what they have so far. I'd like to note that this game won't appeal to everyone
column23: so I'd recommend doing your research beforehand. Also
column24: the golden rule of $1 = 1 Hour of Entertainment looks like it'll be met
column25:
so I'm very happy about that.

RATING:

YouTubers Life receives a 9/10 for me
column26: and I can see this game being a 10/10 for if the developer(s) follow through with their promises
column28:
and add/fix the content that people are talking about.

NOTES:

- I've read about people crashing while playing this game
column29: but I haven't once ever experienced that before."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hi Guys,

Even though I have only 0.5 hours (at time of writing) of gameplay for this game, it is very fun.
Don't listen to the negatives very much, it is actually a cool game where you can chat with ingame friends (so youtuber's life friends) to build up relations (which some people say you can not).

Also you can do multiple things after another, the things get lined up and the charater does them one by one, e.g. Study, sleep, eat, new video.

all in all a very cool game, and if you play this smart, you can enjoy it. (I've seen some actual youtubers play it worse :P)
For example, a youtuber couldn't go to the ingame convention, which I through smart play could attend and still have money left.
As I am typing this I still have 99 bucks in the green.

Signing off,

Kaghy

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Wow! I absolutely love this game! I'm gonna make a list of pros/cons :p

Pros-
>Good Gameplay
>Don't Need A Powerful Setup To Run
>Fun Goals
>Realistic Money System
>Many, Many Upgrades
>Not Realistic Subscriber Gain (Good And Bad?)

Cons-
>Not Realistic Subscriber Gain (Good And Bad?)
>Forces You To Move Places Or You Won't Gain XP (I do see the point in this though, trying to progress the game along)
>Your Phone Is A Flip Phone (Be interesting if you could upgrade your phone and add additional features to it)

Overall this is a great game, definitely worth $15!

Rating- 9.46/10

Great game. Admittingly I only bought it because a friend recommended it to me, But im glad i did, It was everything I expected and more. Cannot wait to see how the Developers update the game.

Pros
-Highly addictive
-Fun for passing time
-Great for getting a taste of the Youtube life, (Who would not want that?)
-Great for people who like Simulation games

Cons
-Few bugs
-Kinda repetitive
-Options lack detail
-Everything feels kinda rushed

Other than that I highly recommend this game as its quite fun, And hopefully in time more is added
